item.title: Caela add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Writing a book is a horrible, exhausting struggle, like a long bout with some painful illness. One would never undertake such a thing if one were not driven on by some demon whom one can neither resist nor understand." -- George Orwell

item.title: Caela add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "There's a hunger for stories in all of us, adults too. We need stories so much that we're even willing to read bad books to get them, if the good books won't supply them." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Caela add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Caela add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Caela add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "Wasn't writing a kind of soaring, an achievable form of flight, of fancy, of the imagination?" -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Caela add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caela add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "It is a cliche that most cliches are true, but then like most cliches, that cliche is untrue." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Caela add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "An original idea. That can't be too hard. The library must be full of them." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Caela add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Caela add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Twas brillig, and the slithy toves Did gyre and gimble in the wabe: All mimsy were the borogoves, And the mome raths outgrabe." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Caela add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description:
"Alice laughed. 'There's no use trying,' she said. 'One can't believe impossible things.'
I daresay you haven't had much practice,' said the Queen. 'When I was your age, I always did it for half-an-hour a day. Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast. There goes the shawl again!" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Caela add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Death ends a life, not a relationship." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Caela add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Caela add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The greatest enemy of clear language is insincerity." -- George Orwell

item.title: Caela add a quote by philip pullman
item.description:
"I'm trying to undermine the basis of Christian belief... I'm not in the business of offending people. I find the books upholding certain values that I think are important, such as life is immensely valuable and this world is an extraordinarily beautiful place. We should do what we can to increase the amount of wisdom in the world.
[<i>Washington Post interview, 19 February 2001</i>]" -- philip pullman

item.title: Caela add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "It is a mistake to think you can solve any major problems just with potatoes." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Caela add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Mothers are all slightly insane." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Caela add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "People are too complicated to have simple labels." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Caela add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "And, has thou slain the Jabberwock? Come to my arms, my beamish boy! O frabjous day! Callooh! Callay! He chortled in his joy." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Caela add a quote by Mark Haddon
item.description: "...and I wrote a book and that means I can do anything" -- Mark Haddon

item.title: Caela add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Caela add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Caela add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Caela add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Caela add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Caela add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Caela add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Caela add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Caela add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Caela add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain
